{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3496487,"name":"Deö","username":"demiroren_robotics","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/bc79bd/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-30T11:35:25.766Z","cooked":"

Hello Dear Teams,

We are trying to do some testings on our robot. However we cannot see sparkmaxes via PDH. They are reachable if plugged in to the computer directly. I have tried updating everything and checked the wiring a couple times.

I can provide images if needed. Thanks

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":23,"updated_at":"2025-01-30T11:35:25.766Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":20,"reads":133,"readers_count":132,"score":126.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":484269,"topic_slug":"sparkmaxes-not-showing-up-under-pdh","display_username":"Deö","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":71965,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/sparkmaxes-not-showing-up-under-pdh/484269/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3496529,"name":"","username":"EmerqldWither","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/emerqldwither/{size}/226176_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-30T12:44:01.646Z","cooked":"

Can you provide a picture of your wiring? From your description, it sounds like there is no CAN bus connected to your SparkMAX and PDH. A reminder that the black and red wires only carry power, no data.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":23,"updated_at":"2025-01-30T12:44:01.646Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":127,"readers_count":126,"score":30.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":484269,"topic_slug":"sparkmaxes-not-showing-up-under-pdh","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53274,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"1672 Alum | Programming/Electrical"},"post_url":"/t/sparkmaxes-not-showing-up-under-pdh/484269/2","custom_user_title":"1672 Alum | Programming/Electrical","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3496544,"name":"Deö","username":"demiroren_robotics","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/bc79bd/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-30T13:05:35.680Z","cooked":"

WhatsApp Image 2025-01-30 at 16.02.021920×864 191 KB

We could see them under pdh last friday.

PDH says Total Current: 0A if its a clue

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":23,"updated_at":"2025-01-30T13:05:35.680Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":115,"readers_count":114,"score":33.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":484269,"topic_slug":"sparkmaxes-not-showing-up-under-pdh","display_username":"Deö","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":53274,"username":"EmerqldWither","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/emerqldwither/{size}/226176_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":71965,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/sparkmaxes-not-showing-up-under-pdh/484269/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3496548,"name":"","username":"EmerqldWither","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/emerqldwither/{size}/226176_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-30T13:14:08.649Z","cooked":"

They seem to be all receiving power which is good.

What is your REV Hardware Client version and SPARK MAX firmware version? A recent update to both of these got pushed out recently that fixed an issue with not being able to detect Spark MAX’s in rev hardware client.

On a side note, those breakers in your PDH are not legal as per R619. (incorrect)

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":23,"updated_at":"2025-01-30T16:43:38.716Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":110,"readers_count":109,"score":47.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":484269,"topic_slug":"sparkmaxes-not-showing-up-under-pdh","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://frctools.com/2025/rule/R619","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Rule R619 | FRCTools","clicks":6}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53274,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"1672 Alum | Programming/Electrical"},"post_url":"/t/sparkmaxes-not-showing-up-under-pdh/484269/4","custom_user_title":"1672 Alum | Programming/Electrical","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3496550,"name":"Deö","username":"demiroren_robotics","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/bc79bd/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-30T13:17:02.396Z","cooked":"

Our REV Hardware Client version is 17.0.1 and SPARK MAX firmware version is 25.0.3. They are all updated. The breakers came with the kit. What should I do?

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":23,"updated_at":"2025-01-30T13:17:02.396Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":108,"readers_count":107,"score":46.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":484269,"topic_slug":"sparkmaxes-not-showing-up-under-pdh","display_username":"Deö","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":53274,"username":"EmerqldWither","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/emerqldwither/{size}/226176_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":71965,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/sparkmaxes-not-showing-up-under-pdh/484269/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3496568,"name":"","username":"four","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/four/{size}/199902_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-30T13:42:07.838Z","cooked":"

Have you checked the PDH firmware version? If it is not 2025, the SparkMaxes will not show up.

Yes it is updated to 25.0.0

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":23,"updated_at":"2025-01-30T13:44:43.914Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":93,"readers_count":92,"score":18.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":484269,"topic_slug":"sparkmaxes-not-showing-up-under-pdh","display_username":"Deö","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":60512,"username":"four","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/four/{size}/199902_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":71965,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/sparkmaxes-not-showing-up-under-pdh/484269/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3496571,"name":"Adam Fleming","username":"AdamF","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/adamf/{size}/234717_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-30T13:47:10.504Z","cooked":"
EmerqldWither:

On a side note, those breakers in your PDH are not legal as per R619

Those breakers are likely legal. They appear to be the AT2 style

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":23,"updated_at":"2025-01-30T13:47:10.504Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":91,"readers_count":90,"score":68.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":484269,"topic_slug":"sparkmaxes-not-showing-up-under-pdh","display_username":"Adam Fleming","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":41952,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC 3596 Lead Mentor/Alum, FTC 30607 Lead Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/sparkmaxes-not-showing-up-under-pdh/484269/8","custom_user_title":"FRC 3596 Lead Mentor/Alum, FTC 30607 Lead Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3496683,"name":"Mike","username":"Mike_FRC_56","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mike_frc_56/{size}/178961_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-30T15:17:23.033Z","cooked":"

wiring1280×720 202 KB

Just a quick question, is right-most SparkMax plugged in?

If you can see the PDH when you plug into it but you don’t see anything else on the CAN bus, then it could be a bad CAN wire. I know you said you checked them, but if you have spare wire, try swapping the ones that from the PDH to the first (or technically, last, SparkMax to see if that changes.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":23,"updated_at":"2025-01-30T15:17:23.033Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":77,"readers_count":76,"score":20.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":484269,"topic_slug":"sparkmaxes-not-showing-up-under-pdh","display_username":"Mike","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50093,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/sparkmaxes-not-showing-up-under-pdh/484269/9","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3496694,"name":"Matt Middleton","username":"Mattmidd630","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mattmidd630/{size}/266313_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-30T15:27:48.055Z","cooked":"

Just a shot in the dark, but is the CAN “Term” switch on the PDH set to “ON”?

Hello Mike that’s just an extended cable so that SPARK MAX could reach to the PDH. Extending it may be the issue but it wasn’t a problem for a while.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":23,"updated_at":"2025-01-30T15:56:31.922Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":63,"readers_count":62,"score":12.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":484269,"topic_slug":"sparkmaxes-not-showing-up-under-pdh","display_username":"Deö","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":50093,"username":"Mike_FRC_56","name":"Mike","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mike_frc_56/{size}/178961_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":71965,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/sparkmaxes-not-showing-up-under-pdh/484269/11","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3496721,"name":"Deö","username":"demiroren_robotics","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/bc79bd/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-30T15:57:03.156Z","cooked":"

Yes it is. I have tried turning it on and off before.

Can you see the CAN bus when you plug directly into a SparkMAX?
Do you see the PDH when you plug the USB C cable into the PDH? Also, what is the led on the pdh?

","post_number":13,"post_type":1,"posts_count":23,"updated_at":"2025-01-30T16:43:08.371Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":60,"readers_count":59,"score":17.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":484269,"topic_slug":"sparkmaxes-not-showing-up-under-pdh","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53274,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"1672 Alum | Programming/Electrical"},"post_url":"/t/sparkmaxes-not-showing-up-under-pdh/484269/13","custom_user_title":"1672 Alum | Programming/Electrical","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3496772,"name":"Deö","username":"demiroren_robotics","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/bc79bd/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-30T16:53:27.358Z","cooked":"

I can see all of our SPARK MAXs when we plug it direclty including roboRIO.
And I can see the PDH when I plug it directly to my computer. It blinks magenta.
